text: BBC Christchurch coverage under the spotlight tonight: Including accusations of @BBCNewsnight giving a platform to the far right. The editorial director of @BBCNews  @bbckamal is answering questions on @newswatchbbc tonight 745pm Newsch/745am Sat BBC1
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Thankyou! It was fabulous talking to you.
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Been discussing betraying the people you say you care about & doing it repeatedly. For years. What were we talking about? Tom Hiddleston, @ZaweAshton & Charlie Cox on Harold Pinter’s play on last night’s @BBCFrontRow of course! http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/m0003d97 …
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: So kind thankyou x

text: Thankyou! I'm now also dealing with recovered memories of the fish in Mr Trimble

text: @DrMatthewSweet following up yesterday's conversation, can you remind me of your Source for this please?
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Hey my error... Save me from the wrath of the Shakespeare scholars. I said Prince Hal when I meant Henry V. Infamy infamy...
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Yes you’re right not in the main channels is what I meant.
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Well Infamy.. infamy they ripped off from Denis Norden and Frank Muir, but Kenneth Williams delivered it so well... And Fenella Fielding is unsurpassed. I CANNOT CHOOSE.
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: And credit/blame where it's due: It was @doranelli's idea to get me to big up my Shakespeare v Carry On analysis to claim that Carry Ons are BETTER than Shakespeare.
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Thankyou. I'm always right about Such Matters. x
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: In which I carry on again all high brow about Carry Ons & present my Controversial View about Sid James (@ me kindly, people) Loved doing this interview with @CarryOnJoan   http://carryonfan.blogspot.com/2019/03/carry-on-blogging-interview-samira-ahmed.html …
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Yes you're right. named in a story about not naming him in all the R4 summaries/bulletins from 6am that I checked.
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: @msmirandasawyer Hey Miranda hope all's well can I drop you a quick message about something?
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: There’s a really interesting case to say think carefully about when you need to name such murderers -obviously sometimes you do- and minimize it to print/written online rather than audio/in vision where you can. But deliberately inserting it where it wasn’t necessary really jars.
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: I think they weren’t naming him at 630 which sounded so appropriate but then inserted his name in later summaries which really jars.
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: BBC radio bulletins reporting the NZ PM’s reasons for not using name of Christ Church mass murderer and then naming him in the same sentence is a curious editorial decision.
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Such a great film!
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Thanks Jimmy!
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Thanks Nick. She was one of the most impressive interviewees I've ever met.

text: Tonight's @bbcfrontrow: @Sarahc_k reviews The White Crow, Joshua Harmon (Admissions) & Bruce Norris on tackling real life drama in theatre, rebuilding Mosul University Library after ISIS  & we delve into the sound of Dick Dale's surf guitar.. https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/m0003cvv … 715pm R4
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Surely Margaret Rutherford. And even cooler, she was hardly there before she ran off early with her family to do variety.
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Ex-@BBCNewsnight producer @farahjassat is among the journalists expressing serious concerns about BBC editorial decisions around Christ Church terrorist massacre, Expect @newswatchbbc to discuss coverage with a senior BBC figure this Friday.
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Heard your excellent report this morning. Really unsettling.
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Remarkable disturbing reporting by @Sanchia7 about the fake news being churned out by the British government during the Cold War. Notably stirring up racial tension around African students in the Eastern Bloc..
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Reminder that @newswatchbbc responds to audience feedback. So please tweet or even better email newswatch@bbc.co.uk with views on the Christ Church terrorist attack coverage. News Online as much as TV news. Give examples if you can.
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Well funny you should say that. Can't promise anything but it's an idea that I'm very keen on.

text: All hail uppity women.

text: Especially on the Bradford week of special focus which was planned a long time before Brexit madness hit its current crisis level.
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: It’s @newswatchbbc day tomorrow. I am out harvesting thoughts to fill the barn. Do you have happy thoughts about Bbc news coverage of things? Or other thoughts? Just wondered. Do Email newswatch@bbc.co.uk
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: On the US admissions thing. There was an entire episode of Daria about how privileged children of alumni have always had easier access into Ivy League unis.
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Plus I think it’s the only musical that got a track on a Beatles album.
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: Plus the spirit of Robert Preston LIVES
author: SamiraAhmedUK

text: The Music Man might not seem obviously topical or political but love that Hugh Jackman has chosen to revive a musical about the joy of libraries and teaching schoolchildren to play musical instruments.. oh and private sector fraudsters..
author: SamiraAhmedUK
